measurableElement.name: The facility has established procedure for continuity of care during interdepartmental transfer
A person is identified for care during all steps of care
The facility provides appropriate referral linkages to the patients/Services for transfer to other/higher facilities to assure the continuity of care.
The facility identifies vulnerable patients and ensure their safe care
The facility identifies high risk patients and ensure their care, as per their need
There is established procedure for managing patients, in case beds are not available at the facility
There is established procedure for admission of patients
The facility has established procedure for registration of patients
There are established procedures for Post-testing Activities
There is process for identifying and cautious administration of high alert drugs
There is a procedure to check drug before administration/ dispensing
Medication orders are written legibly and adequately
There is a system to ensure right medicine is given to right patient
All the assessments, re-assessment and investigations are recorded and updated
Procedures performed are written on patients records
Adequate form and formats are available at point of use
Register/records are maintained as per guidelines
All treatment plan prescription/orders are recorded in the patient records.
The facility has disaster management plan in place
Procedure for ensuring timely and accurate nursing care as per treatment plan is established at the facility
Procedure for identification of patients is established at the facility
There is established procedure of patient hand over, whenever staff duty change happens
There is procedure for periodic monitoring of patients
Facility staff adheres to protocol for counselling on danger signs, post-partum family planning and exclusive breast feeding
Facility staff adheres to protocol for assessment of condition of mother and baby and providing adequate postpartum care
The facility has established procedures for stabilization/treatment/referral of post natal complications
Facility staff adheres to protocol for ensuring care of newborns with small size at birth
There is established procedure for initial assessment of patients
There is established procedure for follow-up/ reassessment of Patients
There is procedure of rational use of drugs
The facility ensured that drugs are prescribed in generic name only
There is established procedure for transfusion of blood
Death of admitted patient is adequately recorded and communicated
The facility has standard procedures for handling the death in the hospital
Staff identifies and manages infection in pregnant woman
Facility staff adheres to standard protocols for identification and management of PPH.
Facility ensures Physical and emotional support to the pregnant women means of birth companion of her choice
Facility staff adheres to standard procedure for active management of third stage of labour
There is an established procedure for assisted and C-section deliveries per scope of services.
Facility staff adheres to standard protocols for identification and management of Pre Eclampsia / Eclampsia
Facility staff adheres to standard protocol for identification and management of preterm delivery.
Facility staff adheres to standard procedures for management of second stage of labour.
Facility staff adheres to standard protocols for Management of HIV in Pregnant Woman & Newborn
There is Established protocol for newborn resuscitation is followed at the facility.
Facility staff adheres to standard procedures for routine care of new-born immediately after birth
The facility ensures standard practices and materials for decontamination and cleaning of instruments and procedures areas
The facility ensures standard practices and materials for disinfection and sterilization of instruments and equipment
Layout of the department is conducive for the infection control practices
The facility ensures availability of standard materials for cleaning and disinfection of patient care areas
The facility ensures standard practices are followed for the cleaning and disinfection of patient care areas
There is Provision of Periodic Medical Check-up and immunization of staff
The facility has provision for Passive and active culture surveillance of critical & high risk areas
The facility has established procedures for regular monitoring of infection control practices
The facility ensures adequate personal protection Equipment as per requirements
The facility staff adheres to standard personal protection practices
The facility Ensures segregation of Bio Medical Waste as per guidelines and 'on-site' management of waste is carried out as per guidelines
The facility ensures management of sharps as per guidelines
The facility ensures transportation and disposal of waste as per guidelines
The facility ensures standard practices and materials for antisepsis
Hand washing facilities are provided at point of use
The facility staff is trained in hand washing practices and they adhere to standard hand washing practices
The facility has established system for use of check lists in different departments and services
The facility has established internal quality assurance programme in key departments
The facility has a quality team in place
The facility maps its critical processes
The facility takes corrective action to improve the processes
The facility identifies non value adding activities / waste / redundant activities
Facility has de defined quality objectives to achieve mission and quality policy
Mission, Values, Quality policy and objectives are effectively communicated to staff and users of services
Departmental standard operating procedures are available
Work instructions are displayed at Point of use
Standard Operating Procedures adequately describes process and procedures
Staff is trained and aware of the procedures written in SOPs
Periodic assessment for Medication and Patient care safety risks is done as per defined criteria.
The facility ensures non compliances are enumerated and recorded adequately
The facility conducts periodic internal assessment
Action plan is made on the gaps found in the assessment / audit process
Planned actions are implemented through Quality improvement cycle (PDCA)
The facility uses method for quality improvement in services
The facility uses tools for quality improvement in services
Facility measures Clinical Care & Safety Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures productivity Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures efficiency Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures Service Quality Indicators on monthly basis
The facility provides Intensive care Services
The facility provides Accident & Emergency Services
The facility provides cashless services to pregnant women, mothers and neonates as per prevalent government schemes
The facility has adequate technicians/paramedics as per requirement
There is a procedure for secure storage of narcotic and psychotropic drugs
The facility has established procedures for changing of linen in patient care areas
The facility ensures safe and adequate storage and retrieval of medical records
There is a established procedure for monitoring and reporting Transfusion complication
There is established procedure for issuing blood
Facility has established procedures for Pre Anaesthetic Check up
Facility has established procedures for Post Anaesthesia care
Facility has established procedures for monitoring during anaesthesia
Facility has established procedures for Surgical Safety
Facility has established procedures OT Scheduling
Facility has established procedures for Preoperative care
Facility has established procedures for Post operative care
There are established procedures for Pre-testing Activities
Facility ensures air quality of high risk area
Facility has defined and established antibiotic policy
Facility measures hospital associated infection rates
Provider assesses uterine tone and bleeding per vaginum regularly after delivery
Provider performs all steps as per protocol in case of PPH
Provider ensures immediate drying, and asses breathing
Provider delivers the baby on mothers abdomen,
Provider weighs the baby and administers Vitamin K
Provider ensures early initiation of breastfeeding
Provider performs delayed cord clamping and cutting
Provider switches radiant warmer on 30 min before childbirth
Provider ensures functional items for newborn care and resuscitation
Provider ensures availability of pre-filled oxytocin syringe
Provder ensures sterile/HLD delivery tray is available
Provider counsels on danger signs, post-partum family planning and exclusive breast feeding
Provider takes obstetric, medical and surgical history
Provider assesses gestational age correctly
Provider records fetal heart rate
Provider records mothers BP
Provider records mothers temperature
Provider facilitates thermal management including kangaroo mother care
Provider facilitates assisted feeding whenever required
Provider facilitate specialist care in newborn <1800 gm
Provider performs AMTSL and examines placenta thoroughly
Provider checks for test results or recommends testing if not done
Provider appropriately manages newborn of HIV seropositive mother
Provider appropriately manages HIV seropositive cases
Provider appropriately manages HIV seropositive pregnant woman (Facilities without ART center)
Provider conducts PV examination as per indication
Provider cleans the perineum appropriately before conducting PV examination
Provider performs hand hygiene
Provider records the finding of PV examination (in Case sheet/Partograph during active phase of labour)
Provider timely uses partograph in every case.
Provider interprets partograph correctly and adjusts care according to findings
Provider correctly plots all parameters
Provider counsels mother on importance of exclusive breast feeding
Provider identifies mothers with severe PE/E
Provider gives correct regimen of Injn MgSO for prevention and management of convulsions
Provider performs nursing care
Provider ensures specialist attention for care of mother and newborn
Provider facilitates prescription of anti-hypertensives
Provider treats woman and her companion cordially and respectfully (RMC), ensures privacy and confidentiality to woman during her stay
Provider encourages the presence of birth companion during labour
Provider explains danger signs and important care activities to mother and her companion during her stay (for mother and baby)
Provider records BP of mother
Provider looks for signs of hypothermia in baby
Provider looks for signs of infection in mother
Provider looks for signs of infection in baby
Provider ensures six cleans while conducting delivery
Provider performs an episiotomy only if indicated
Provider allows spontaneous delivery of head by flexing it and giving perineal support; manages cord round the neck; assists delivery of shoulders and body
Biomedical waste is segregated and disposed of as per the guidelines
Follows universal precaution
Hand hygiene is performed before and after each procedure and sterile/HLD gloves are worn during delivery and internal examination
Instruments and gloves are decontaminated after each use using Bleaching powder/ Sodium hypochlorite soln/Gluteraldehyde
Provider gives antibiotics only when indicated
Provider gives correct regimen of antibiotics
Provider looks for signs of infection based on history and examination
Provider appropriately administers antenatal corticosteroids to mothers
Provider does a correct estimation of gestational age to confirm that labour is pre term
Provider ensures specialist attention
Provider identifies conditions that may lead to pre term delivery
Provider initiates bag and mask ventilation for 30 seconds if baby still not breathing
Provider takes appropriate action if baby doesnt respond to ambu bag ventilation after golden minute
Provider performs steps for resuscitation within first 30 seconds:
Criteria for Competence assessment are defined for clinical and Para clinical staff
There is no discrimination on basis of social and economic status of the patients
Patient satisfaction surveys are conducted at periodic intervals
The facility analyses the patient feed back, and root-cause analysis
The facility prepares the action plans for the areas, contributing to low satisfaction of patients
